reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: Despite the changes that swept Egypt during 2011 Egypt still lacks strong institutions which protect human rights and Egyptian citizens lack proper access to the information which they require to inform themselves sufficiently about their rights. The Integ rated Human Rights Education Programme has been specifically developed to address this problem by disseminating and promoting human rights culture values and knowledge to Egyptian youth and providing a space for them to discuss and act upon political and s ocietal developments from a human rights perspective. This project seeks to cater for both those with little if any prior engagement with concepts of human rights and to those who already have some knowledge but are keen to expand upon this knowledge to ex press ideas with other youth and to engage in human rights advocacy. The project will respond to the lack of knowledge of human rights in Egypt by training more than 100 Egyptian youth in human rights and advocacy. The follow-up Alumni Network Forum and Yo ung Trainers Program will develop the critical thinking capacity and rhetorical skills of participants of the 2012 Student?s Summer Course as well as of CIHRS alumni of previous years so as to enable them to effectively advocate for human rights.
